title: One dead, three wounded in East Hills shooting
content:
A 22-year-old man died and three others — including two children — were wounded in a shooting Saturday outside an East Hills apartment building, authorities said.
The shooting occurred around 12:30 p.m. in the Maple Ridge apartments in the 2100 block of Park Hill Drive.
Niles Young, 22, whose address was not immediately known, was shot multiple times and died about an hour later at UPMC Presbyterian.
A 29-year-old woman was shot in the arm, an 11-year-old girl was grazed in the foot, and an 8-year-old boy was injured when the window of an apartment was shattered and glass struck him, according to city police spokeswoman Sonya Toler.
The three wounded people were also taken to UPMC Presbyterian, according to Ms. Toler, and they were in stable condition.
“The male was working on a car here in the parking lot, while the two females were seated in a different car,” said Ms. Toler, in a media briefing at the Park Hill Drive scene. “We believe some shooters – we do not know how many, we do believe there were more than one – came out of the wooded area and began shooting at the male from there.”
Mr. Young was shot three times in the back and was pronounced dead at the hospital at 1:32 p.m.
The two women were sitting in a car next to the one on which the Mr. Young was working. They fled into an apartment, Ms. Toler said. Police do not yet know whether they were shot while in a car or en route to the apartment.
Acting police Chief Scott Schubert was on the scene this afternoon, along with violent crime unit detectives and Zone 5 officers.
At mid-afternoon, police had no description of the shooters, and had not finished analyzing ballistic evidence.
